===Definitions===
{{zh-hanzi}}

# a [[footbridge]], a ([[small]]) [[bridge]]
#: {{zh-x|橋樑|bridge}}
# [[beam]], [[crosspiece]]

====Usage notes====
Most of the things English terms ''bridges''—as over rivers—are described in modern Chinese as {{zh-l|橋樑}}, whereas {{lang|zh|橋}} is used for small, level crossings, as over canals or small ditches.

===Etymology===
{{ja-kanjitab|はし|yomi=k}}
{{IPAchar|/pasi/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɸasi/}} → {{IPAchar|/hasi/}}

From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=はし}}, originally indicating either the area between two things, or a connection between two things.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Cognate with {{m|ja|階|tr=hashi||stairs from a garden up to the house}}, both cognate with root ''hasa'' indicating the narrow area between two things, as in {{m|ja|狭間|pos=classical ''hasama'', modern ''hazama''||narrow gap between two things}} or {{m|ja|挟む|tr=hasamu||to put between two things that are close together, to squeeze between two things}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Cognate also with root ''hoso'' indicating the narrowness of a thing itself, as in {{m|ja|細い|tr=hosoi||narrow, slender}}, {{m|ja|細める|tr=hosomeru||to narrow something, to make something narrow}}.
